[[Lithuanian army]] | wars = [[Continuation War]] | designer = [[Tampella]] | design_date = | manufacturer = [[Tampella]] | unit_cost = | production_date = | number = 596 by Tampella | variants = | spec_label = | weight ={{convert|260|kg|lb}} | length = | part_length =189cm | width = | height = | diameter = | crew = | passengers = | cartridge = | cartridge_weight = | caliber ={{convert|120|mm|cm}} | barrels = | action = | rate = up to 20 shots/minute | velocity = 116-290 m/s | range = | max_range ={{convert|5300|m|ft}} | feed = | sights = | breech = | recoil = | carriage = | elevation = | traverse = | blade_type = | hilt_type = | sheath_type = | head_type = | haft_type = | filling = | filling_weight = | detonation = | yield = | armour = | primary_armament = | secondary_armament = | engine = | engine_power = | pw_ratio = | transmission = | payload_capacity = | suspension = | clearance = | fuel_capacity = | vehicle_range = | speed = | guidance = | steering = | wingspan = | propellant = | ceiling = | altitude = | depth = | boost = | accuracy = | launch_platform = | transport = }} '''120 Krh/40''' is a 120 mm [[mortar (weapon)|mortar]] developed by Finnish [[Tampella]] (now Patria Vammas). == Use in Sweden == The ''120 Krh/40'' was exported to Sweden between 1941 and 1944 and later produced under license in Sweden. A total of 219 was exported by Tampella. The Swedish military calls them ''12 cm granatkastare m/41'' and they have continued to serve as the standard [[mortar (weapon)|heavy mortar]] of the [[Swedish Army]]. They got a major increase in lethality when the STRIX top attack anti armour round was introduced in the 1990s it's a smart weapon that homes in on the IR signature of armoured vehicles. == External links == {{commons category|120 Krh 40}} * [http://www.janes.com/articles/Janes-Infantry-Weapons/m-41D-120-mm-mortar-Sweden.html m/41D 120 mm mortar (Sweden)] â€“ Jane's Infantry Weapons == References == http://www.jaegerplatoon.net/MORTARS6.htm {{DEFAULTSORT:M 41D}} [[Category:120 mm artillery]] [[Category:Infantry mortars]] [[Category:Artillery of Sweden]] [[Category:World War II military equipment of Finland]] [[Category:Mortars of Finland]]
